August 29, 1993: Fiction
WITHOUT REMORSE, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $24.95.) John Kelly becomes
involved in a Pentagon project to rescue prisoners held in North Vietnam.
THE BRIDGES OF MADISON COUNTY, by Robert James Waller. (Warner,
$16.95.) A photographer and a lonely farmer's wife in Iowa.
VANISHED, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $23.95.) The abduction of their young
son creates a crisis for a New York man and woman and for the woman's first
lover.
STREETS OF LAREDO, by Larry McMurtry. (Simon & Schuster, $25.) A Texas
bounty hunter goes south of the border in pursuit of a train robber and killer.
THE CLIENT, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $23.50.) A deadly secret, revealed
by a lawyer just before he kills himself, presents problems for an 11-year-old boy.
LIKE WATER FOR CHOCOLATE, by Laura Esquivel. (Doubleday, $17.50.)
Frustration, love, hope -- and recipes -- sampled by a woman on a Mexican ranch.
THE NIGHT MANAGER, by John le Carr√©. (Knopf, $24.) A Zurich hotelman's life
in the world of arms dealers, dope smugglers and international terrorists.
THE SHINING ONES, by David Eddings. (Del Rey/Ballantine, $22.) The second
volume of "The Tamuli," a fantasy saga.
PIGS IN HEAVEN, by Barbara Kingsolver. (HarperCollins, $22.) The stresses and
strains that befall a mother and her adopted Cherokee daughter.
PLEADING GUILTY, by Scott Turow. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $24.) A lawyer in
pursuit of his firm's missing partner and a multimillion-dollar fund.
HONOR AMONG THIEVES, by Jeffrey Archer. (HarperCollins, $23.) Saddam
Hussein plots to steal and destroy the Declaration of Independence.
CRUEL & UNUSUAL, by Patricia D. Cornwell. (Scribners, $21.) Dr. Kay Scarpetta
investigates mysteries involving a man executed for murder.
AFTER ALL THESE YEARS, by Susan Isaacs. (HarperCollins, $23.) The plight of
a woman whose estranged husband is found murdered in her house.
A CASE OF NEED, by Michael Crichton writing as Jeffery Hudson. (Dutton,
$18.95.) A 1968 novel about the mysterious death of a surgeon's daughter.
HILL TOWNS, by Anne Rivers Siddons. (HarperCollins, $22.) Americans on a
holiday in Italy learn a lot about their marriage and themselves.
August 29, 1993
Non-Fiction
WOMEN WHO RUN WITH THE WOLVES, by Clarissa Pinkola Estes. (Ballantine,
$23.) How myths and folk tales can enable women to understand their psyches.
LISTENING TO PROZAC, by Peter D. Kramer. (Viking, $23.) A psychiatrist
discusses mood-changing medications and their effects on a person's self.
EMBRACED BY THE LIGHT, by Betty J. Eadie with Curtis Taylor. (Gold Leaf
Press, $14.95.) A woman's near-death experience.
MAYBE (MAYBE NOT), by Robert Fulghum. (Villard, $19.) Essays suggesting that
inspiration can be found in most unexpected ways and places.
REENGINEERING THE CORPORATION, by Michael Hammer and James
Champy. (Harper Business, $25.) A manifesto for business innovation.
THE WAY THINGS OUGHT TO BE, by Rush H. Limbaugh 3d. (Pocket, $22.)
Anecdotes and opinions offered by the talk-show host.
CARE OF THE SOUL, by Thomas Moore. (HarperCollins, $22.50.) Spirituality and
everyday life.
THE FIFTIES, by David Halberstam. (Villard, $27.50.) A journalist's social,
political, economic and cultural history of the 1950's.
GIRL, INTERRUPTED, by Susanna Kaysen. (Turtle Bay/Random House, $17.) A
memoir of a young woman's mental illness.
MAMA MAKES UP HER MIND, by Bailey White. (Addison-Wesley, $17.95.) Life in
a tiny Georgia town; by a first-grade teacher and radio commentator.
DAYS OF GRACE, by Arthur Ashe and Arnold Rampersad. (Knopf, $24.) The
memoirs of the late tennis star.
THE HIDDEN LIFE OF DOGS, by Elizabeth Marshall Thomas. (Davison/Houghton
Mifflin, $18.95.) An analysis of canine behavior by a novelist and anthropologist.
HEALING AND THE MIND, by Bill Moyers. (Doubleday, $25.) Conversations with
physicians and others about the relationship of sickness to thoughts and emotions.
RACE MATTERS, by Cornel West. (Beacon, $15.) A Princeton professor assays
issues affecting black Americans.
SECRET CEREMONIES, by Deborah Laake. (Morrow, $20.) The unhappy
marriages of a woman raised as a Mormon.
